channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI

item.title: Report X-2024010463
item.description:
Report X-2024010463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: EAU CLAIRE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer 833861 from MILW was opened up at 01:38 during OTP sort. Immediately upon opening door metal pail rolled off end of rollers and fell out of trailer and landed on concrete. Container damaged as a result of falling and began leaking. No blocking or bracing used for any packages loaded at the edge of trailer. No load net used in trailer. DescribePack: Entire side of container dented, resulting in lid no longer being sealed DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tipped upright, placed in black spill bin

item.title: Report E-2024010431
item.description:
Report E-2024010431

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-25T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: SUN PRAIRIE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was attempting to pump diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a loose cap became dislodged and allowed approximately 60 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
